resources.string: There are several ways by which you can change the angle value currently showing on the unit circle:
1. Touch or drag with your finger or other pointing device on the unit circle itself
2. Tap on the current angle\'s numeric value in either the degrees or radians box to enter an angle value via keyboard
3. Tap on the left/right arrows to cycle through common \"special angles\" whose radian values are expressed in terms of \u03C0
By default, all angle values are shown as positive sign. For example, the positive value 330 degrees will show instead of its negative equivalent of -30 degrees

If you would prefer that some or all angles show their negative values instead of the positive values, you can go back to the main screen and click on the settings icon in the top right of the toolbar. You can then change the angle sign setting by clicking on \"Sign of angles\" in the settings menu
Within the angle sign settings menu, you will have the following options:
"All positive: all angles\' degree and radian values will be shown as positive sign (this is the default)"

"Top positive; Bottom negative: angles with degree value between 0–180 (top half of unit circle) will show as positive sign and angles with degree value greater than 180 (bottom half of unit circle) will show as negative sign"
"All negative: all angles\' degree and radian values will be shown as negative sign"
